pullRequest.body:
Add various lemmas about `orbitRel.Quotient`, mostly concerning `orbitRel.Quotient.orbit`, many concerning orbits for the action of a subgroup.  Along with the lemmas there are instances

```lean
instance (x : orbitRel.Quotient G α) : MulAction G x.orbit where
```

and

```lean
instance (x : orbitRel.Quotient G α) : IsPretransitive G x.orbit where
```

both of which already have analogues for `MulAction.orbit` as opposed to `orbitRel.Quotient.orbit` - and lemmas about the above action on an orbit.

From AperiodicMonotilesLean.


---

nodes.body:
> Probably you should just open the `orbitRel` namespace. (or even `orbitRel.Quotient`.

There's enough overlap with the `MulAction` namespace (that we're inside here) that I suspect having both open would be confusing.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

maintainer merge
Probably you should just open the `orbitRel` namespace. (or even `orbitRel.Quotient`.
I feel your pain regarding quotients and setoids 😢
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
    simp_rw [Submonoid.smul_def, Subgroup.coe_toSubmonoid, ← orbit.coe_smul,
      ← Submonoid.smul_def, ← Subtype.ext_iff] at h
```
This is the second time you've used this `change`. Probably there is just a `rw` lemma missing and you should add it?

I've added `orbitRel_r_apply`.

In general I may not know the best way to make use of the API for quotients; I seem to find a lot that I have things in one form (`Setoid.r`, `Setoid.rel`, something defeq to those for the particular setoid, `≈`, ..., or `mk''` versus `mk` for quotients), and need to keep changing to a different form because the particular lemma I want to use next is only available for some of the forms, and also often find that key information is implicit and not shown in the infoview (making it hard to follow the infoview state, which e.g. just says `Setoid.r` with no information about which setoid is involved, as well as often requiring use of `@`), especially when, as here, dealing with multiple quotients for the same type (orbits for a group and a subgroup thereof, in this case).

I believe the following works
```suggestion
lemma orbitRel_r_apply {a b : α} : (orbitRel G _).r a b ↔ a ∈ orbit G b :=
```
since Lean 4 tries to fill dot notation arguments to any kind of parameters, not just explicit
Maybe turn this one around and `@[simp, norm_cast]` it?
Done.
